intro: Stylodiscus trifoliatus, commonly known as the three-leaf saxifrage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of trifoliate leaves, which are typically arranged in a compact, cushion-like structure. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Stylodiscus trifoliatus is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
